name: MistralAIModel

input.content: gitignore any file called .KEYFILE anywhere under a directory foo, which itself is anywhere

output:
To ignore any file named `.KEYFILE` located anywhere under a directory named `foo`, which itself can be located anywhere in your project, you can add the following line to your `.gitignore` file:

```
foo/**/.KEYFILE
```

Here's a breakdown of the pattern:

- `foo/`: Matches the `foo` directory at any level.
- `**`: Matches any subdirectory (zero or more levels) under the `foo` directory.
- `/.KEYFILE`: Matches the `.KEYFILE` in any of the matched subdirectories.

This pattern will ignore any file named `.KEYFILE` that is located anywhere under a `foo` directory, no matter where the `foo` directory is located in your project.

input:

Here's a breakdown of the pattern:

- `**`: Matches any subdirectory (zero or more levels) under the `foo` directory.
- `/.KEYFILE`: Matches the `.KEYFILE` in any of the matched subdirectories.

This pattern will ignore any file named `.KEYFILE` that is located anywhere under a `foo` directory, no matter where the `foo` directory is located in your project.
